net.minecraft.entity.player

Class InventoryPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.entity.player.InventoryPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInventory, IWorldNameable

    public class InventoryPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IInventory

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ItemStack[] armorInventory
      An array of 4 item stacks containing the currently worn armor pieces.

      The index of the currently held item (0-8).

      Set true whenever the inventory changes.
      private ItemStack itemStack 
      ItemStack[] mainInventory
      An array of 36 item stacks indicating the main player inventory (including the visible bar).
      EntityPlayer player
      The player whose inventory this is.

      • mainInventory

        An array of 36 item stacks indicating the main player inventory (including the visible bar).

        The player whose inventory this is.

      • itemStack

        private ItemStack itemStack

      • inventoryChanged

        public boolean inventoryChanged
        Set true whenever the inventory changes. Nothing sets it false so you will have to write your own code to check it and reset the value.

      • clearMatchingItems

        public int clearMatchingItems(Item itemIn,
                              int metadataIn,
                              int removeCount,
                              NBTTagCompound itemNBT)
        Removes matching items from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        itemIn - The item to match, null ignores.
        metadataIn - The metadata to match, -1 ignores.
        removeCount - The number of items to remove. If less than 1, removes all matching items.
        itemNBT - The NBT data to match, null ignores.
        Returns:
        The number of items removed from the inventory.

      • changeCurrentItem

        public void changeCurrentItem(int p_70453_1_)
        Switch the current item to the next one or the previous one

      • storePartialItemStack

        private int storePartialItemStack(ItemStack itemStackIn)
        This function stores as many items of an ItemStack as possible in a matching slot and returns the quantity of left over items.

      • decrementAnimations

        public void decrementAnimations()
        Decrement the number of animations remaining. Only called on client side. This is used to handle the animation of receiving a block.

      • consumeInventoryItem

        public boolean consumeInventoryItem(Item itemIn)
        removed one item of specified Item from inventory (if it is in a stack, the stack size will reduce with 1)

      • writeToNBT

        public NBTTagList writeToNBT(NBTTagList p_70442_1_)
        Writes the inventory out as a list of compound tags. This is where the slot indices are used (+100 for armor, +80 for crafting).

      • readFromNBT

        public void markDirty()
